Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: How can you not love anything Apple makes...purchased this macbook and by no surprise I love it! Will have to see how well it holds up next to my old hp (which sucks)!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I bought the baseline mac with the intention of replacing the hard drive and adding more ram. I have to say the computer wasnt too bad before the additions. Boot up time was about 35 seconds and the programs were loaded fairly quick. The only drawback is that it became a little warm but not nearly as bad as how others described it. After replacing the stock hdd with a samsung 830 ssd 256gb and 8gb corsair ram, the computer is lighting fast and the temp stays pretty cool. Im very happy with the trackpad and the solid aluminum build. I feel like it was worth the extra few bucks.

Reviews.Title: SUPER
Reviews.Author: just me
Reviews.Content: My macbook pro is great!It is an apple so what else do you want :-)spent some extra money, try it and you never want another

Reviews.Title: Mac Pro
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I received the Mac Pro in 2 days thanks to Prime. This is my first Apple Laptop. I love it. I love how the keyboard lights up.The Mac Air is super fast.And thanks to Amazon the price was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Makes a wonderful gift
Reviews.Author: Hasan Bazerbashi
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to talk much about the technical side because there are tons of it online.I got this Mac as a gift to my wife on our anniversary and she was stunned :) So aside from the technical specifications I would say that this is diffidently a great gift.I chose the Mac for a few reasons:- It looks fabulous!- Durable- Extendable (You can upgrade memory and hard disk - not the Mac Air ver)- It is luxurious like a jewelry- The system is easy enough for her and she saw it before- As an all time Windows user I was interested to try the system too :)She love it and I did like it a lot, but I'm going with a Windows 8 device when it comes out ;)

Reviews.Title: Love it, great for school.
Reviews.Author: koolmommyof2
Reviews.Content: I bought this MacBook Pro for my son (6th grade, he payed for most of it) and he absolutely loves it. It is very fast and looks better than any PC. Also, Mountain Lion is great, and my son has used it for 3 reports already (2 Pages, 1 Keynote) and they all looked very good. The Keynote on was by far the best, and was something that you could never do on Word.

Reviews.Title: Best laptop and computer in the world!!
Reviews.Author: Stephen77
Reviews.Content: I cannot speak highly enough about my new  Apple Mac Pro 15 Inch Laptop - mid 2012 edition. It is quite simply the best. Yes, it's very expensive, but like the old saying goes - you get what you pay for. Apple has made a working work of art. The Mac Pro is simply beautiful and the quality is unmatched. The trackpad is so amazing, that words alone do not do justice to it's simplicity and effectiveness - you have to use it, to fully appreciate it. The design is clean and functional. The aluminum body exudes quality, ruggedness, and coolness. The pre-loaded software is awesome. iTunes alone defies comparison to anything. This laptop is a pleasure to use. It is addictive to use, from the light touch of the keypads, to the beautiful screen, to the ridiculous apps you can download - many free. I highly recommend this laptop to anyone who appreciates a very, very high quality product and will take of it. I am a new Mac addict.

Reviews.Title: ALSO a pc user... 's review
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: As you can see from the title, I also use PC. My desktop is a PC and the macbook pro is just something I picked up.This laptop is an absolute beauty. The Mac OS is surprisingly fun. Windows allows more "tweaking" but the Mac was just plain fun to use.The display's resolution isn't the best. However......... Actually, I'm not going into ANY details on the pros as you can probably see from all the other reviews.***************************I want to mention a few cosmetic caveats:The aluminum: VERY beautiful but also VERY prone to damage. Try not to get too much sweat on the aluminum, as it will cause these black specks to appear that cannot be erased. I recommend getting a palmguard as well as an outer case/ skin.Keyboard: the material of the keycaps WILL wear out. I know a lot about keyboards and this type of material will definitely gloss up/ wear out. I recommend a keyboard skin.Besides these 2 caveats, I still give this a 5/5. Very nice.Oh right... honestly, comparing PC to APPLE, the price is a little steep. Everyone knows that Apple charges more because it produces it's own thing. However, it's still a great machine.

Reviews.Title: Nice laptop
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: Really nice laptop, with all the quality i've looking for. The length of the battery is awesome. I hven't use a mac book before that one, and it is easy to use

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Scottwestcoast
Reviews.Content: I'm a convert.  I have an iphone and iPod and decided it was time to venture into a laptop.  I'm now spoiled.  Upon opening up the computer I was guided through migrating all of my data from my old pc.  Fast, easy, done.  The speed of the MacBook Pro is amazing.  In the past on my pc I would click on an e-mail and wait, and wait, fold some laundry, come back, wait some more, while the program opened.  No more.  It's nearly instant.  When I open the lid to my Mac it instantly responds and I'm on the net.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE PRODUCT, HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, TRIED TO RETURN IT AND IT'S TAKING ME 3 MONTHS TO DO SO AND ONLY 80% IS REFUNDED.
Reviews.Author: dchyou
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. The Macbook was defective and kept restarting itself so I couldn't even use the product. Proof that Apple products aren't as amazing as they're hyped up to be.So naturally, I tried returning it to Amazon but I had moved locations after I bought the Macbook, so UPS kept REPEATEDLY coming to the wrong address to try and pick it up. The customer service was TERRIBLE as I tried returning it before the 30-day policy, but they kept telling me to do different things each time so it got delayed to THREE MONTHS. I had FINALLY managed to get the Macbook shipped to the Amazon location but they actually SHIPPED IT BACK TO ME BECAUSE THEY THOUGHT IT WAS THE WRONG ITEM. So now I have to wait until I go back to that address and call them to come pick it up then.The best part of course is because it's being returned back after the 30-day return policy due to Amazon's incompetent customer service of handling A SIMPLE PICK UP AND RETURN, I am only being refunded 80% of the amount - meaning I lose $300. For buying a damn defective Macbook.Moral of the story? Don't buy expensive things from Amazon. If you're buying an Apple product, just do it the safe way and buy it directly from Apple and save yourself the hassle. Who knows how Apple will try to rip you off.

Reviews.Title: Nothing less than the best
Reviews.Author: Kelsey Miller
Reviews.Content: The summer after my senior year of high school was one of the most exciting times of my life, thus far. I was finally done with high school and moving on to bigger and better things. All my life I had been striving for the best and getting my first laptop was not going to be anything short of the best. After my graduation party and selling my car, I finally saved enough money to purchase my first `real' life purchase. I knew I wanted a MacBook Pro since early senior year and now was the time that I was finally going to get it! I begged my mom to come with me to Best Buy to help me buy it. She didn't see the need to come with so I brought my sister. Checking and double checking that I had the right amount of money in my checking account I told the sales woman that I'd like to buy a MacBook Pro 13 inch. She gladly went to the back to get it and without hesitation I swiped my debit card. A screen popped up asking if I wanted to purchase insurance. Being the 18-year-old kid with only a new laptop on my mind, I stupidly said no thanks. After signing my life savings away, I walked/ran out of the store carrying my new `baby', just as the store was closing for the night. Getting home I opened the box and started to set-up and install all of the new and coolest things on my computer. At around 12:30 that night, after convincing my mom that Macs never had any problems and they were the best laptops around, my laptop completely shut down. It was charging so I knew the battery was fine, but it still wouldn't turn back on. Reluctantly I walked downstairs with tears forming in my eyes. How would I tell my mom that it wasn't working. After spending what seemed like days on her laptop searching what could be wrong, we decided to call the Apple helpline. They were dumbfounded, just as we were. They said that we must have gotten the `lemon' and that I should not have any problems returning it tomorrow for a new one. It was the longest night of my life. Waking up at the crack of dawn, we exchanged the `lemon' for a new one, as well as bought the highest amount of insurance possible. I've now had it for almost a year and have not had any problems with it. If I had to choose a MacBook over a windows laptop, I would still pick the MacBook hands down even with the small mishap in the beginning. I definitely think that the saying of `good things happen to those who wait,' truly applies to me, if I waited rather than being rash, I would have had no problems with my `baby.'

Reviews.Title: apple sauce
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: I had 2 mac book pro's and they both froze up. I called an apple genius and he said mac does not do that. We checked the hard drive and it was ok on both of them. End result is both mac book pro's are back at apple. Pc for now on.

Reviews.Title: Expensive but worth it
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: it's  a great laptop, fast, silent - plays Flash HD content without any noise now.What hasn't been improved is battery life - despite the new Intel platform it's actually slightly worse.It's overpriced too - for same or less  money you can get full HD ANTIGLARE screen and better specs from most competitors.Major problem for me is a glossy screen - even in dark room it reflects any light source directly into eyes - this not just annoying, this is officially bad for human eyes. I will have to return this to get anti-glare version, which is another $200 on top of already steep price - this is just a robbery!

Reviews.Title: No versatility
Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: I was super excited to get this laptop but when i received the product I was very disappointed because I realized that the computer is just not worth its price.Pros:-Very easy to use even a dummy could do it!-The aluminum case  gives it a very sleek look-Shortcuts are nice to use (then again all computers have their own shortcuts)-Interchangeable screens make it very easy to go from program to programCons:-The constant software updates are very needy and makes the computer lag and slow down-There is no versatility when using this laptop meaning that I am not able to install certain programs that I am able to use on a pc-Non interchangeable internal parts.-No graphics card making the computer lag when watching movies and or videos (in case people didnt know Intel HD Graphics 4000 is not a graphics card. That is basically the pcu running the graphics (cheaper alternative).-Computer is just not worth the price (its just hyped up). You could get a better computer that runs on i7 and has 8gb of ram 1.5TB with SSD cards and a nice graphics card for that price.Overall I would not recommend this computer. I like the way it looks but the internal system is just not for me. Its more for students, artists, and people who like everything preset for them. I also dislike the fact that they constantly nag you to update to their new software.

Reviews.Title: Exorbitant Seller Return Fee Policy
Reviews.Author: Joy Graves
Reviews.Content: Purchased Apple MacBook Pro MD101LL/A 13.3 inch laptop for $1,198.00  I am a student and a writer, the product was good, but was far too small for my needs.  I returned the product.  The return shipping fees/insurance cost me $150 via FedEx--I was trying to return it in the best and most expeditious manner to DataVision Computer Video.  To my surprise I was only refunded $1,006.  Almost $200 was deducted for a 15% "restocking fee"---give me a break. Therefore I am out a little more than $350 for viewing this laptop for a little less than a week!! If you purchase the product and write a great review that's fine--but if you return the product, you are penalized!  As a student, it is a price I cannot afford!

Reviews.Title: Awfull!
Reviews.Author: Marcelo Irigoin
Reviews.Content: I recived the computer with an open box, the computer has an accidental damage, the computer case is twisted. I already ship the computer overseas and my client give me that feedback

Reviews.Title: Beautiful!
Reviews.Author: Preslye
Reviews.Content: This item is of course amazing! I mean anyone that has used a Mac before knows the quality of these products are amazing and worth the hefty price tag. They are durable and seem to last forever. I Would certainly purchase again, and again, and again lol.

Reviews.Title: Not as impressed as I thought I'd be
Reviews.Author: ocean78
Reviews.Content: I have been working primarily on PC's with GNU/linux since 2006. My company bought me the Apple Macbook Pro MD101LL/A 13.3-Inch laptop because I have to build some mobile applications with XCode.Coming from Ubuntu, I quickly learned that the Apple developer world is not as well-supported by applications I commonly use such as wine for running Windows software. An application I've been running on Wine in Ubuntu does not run on OSX. There's Virtualbox but not VMWare player. My favorite desktop editor Geany is not available on OSX and a lot of the better text editors are expensive. Running Ubuntu in Virtualbox in OSX is pretty fast so that's what I've been doing to get my real work done. Also, can't get Terminator (probably the best terminal application in existence on OSX). Boo hoo.There is some software that it's nice to finally have a chance to try out like Unity3D and there are more games available on Steam, not that I have a lot of time to play them right now.The laptop case seems pretty sturdy but the keys seem like they're designed to pop off. They feel flimsy and this surprised me. Also, I hate not having a right mouse button click implemented on the touchpad.If you have to use OSX or you're worried about what people will think of you if you don't have an Apple than this is the laptop for you. Otherwise you can get a comparable laptop for 60 - 70% of the price and put Ubuntu on it and have a better offering of free software and a more robust developer environment.

Reviews.Title: Do not order from Amazon Warehouse Deals.... the shipping/packaging is terrible!
Reviews.Author: bookworm71
Reviews.Content: The first one I ordered arrived in original computer box, with picture on the outside of what it was, just left sitting on my doorstep for the neighbors and passersby to see.  The box was beat all to hell.  Could not believe that it was sent this way, but decided to try it out since there is a 30-day money back guarantee.  Well, the computer did not work properly.  Could not even get it past the set-up stage.  I called Apple Care to try and troubleshoot it with them, and they were totally boggled about it.  I just think it got beat up during the shipping process and was messed up internally.So, I called to complain about it, to get my money back, and explained the way it was shipped and left.  Amazon rep I spoke with seemed surprised, and immediately issued refund to me.  In order to send it back, though, I had to prepare different packaging because it had to be insured (over $1000 item), and UPS would not accept it to send back the very same way it was shipped to me.  It cost $42.00 for UPS to insure and package it properly to send it back to Amazon.  I had to fight with Amazon to get that $42 reimbursed to me.  But they did.So... next chapter.... I ordered another one, thinking surely they would not send it the same way again.  But they sure did.  Except for not leaving it at my door and having me go to UPS office to pick up in person.  But it did not have any separate box/padding for shipping/handling.  Such an expensive piece of equipment should be better protected for shipping.  I did not even take it home the second time... just said return to sender immediately.I ordered a third laptop, of the brand new, not refurbished variety, still waiting to receive it.  I am hoping it will be shipped in a better manner.  If it's not, I will be returning to sender on that one, too.

Reviews.Title: Nice and Hot~ But not in the Halle Berry Sense! It Did Get Better ~ But Really, Not Worth the Price
Reviews.Author: Nu Mantra
Reviews.Content: So where do I begin so that the legions of Apple critics and fans do not view this as support of their narrow views? I will say that I am not into the Windows vs. OSX argument - I do not think Apple is evil nor that they have, hands downs, the best products. I have had Windows desktops and one laptop - and yes - I had the typical problems with them that are often used as reasons for one jumping ship to Apple.I had said that my next notebook would be an Apple, but never really wanted to pay Apple's steep price. OPEN BOX is the way to go - I got 10% off a returned MacBook that looks to have never been used - the power cords had not even been unwrapped. Then - as a student and an educator - I was able to get another $100 off the price. Still, at nearly a grand after taxes, the cost was pretty steep when BB had PCs with similar or better specs for half the price.So, why stick with this? I want to find out for myself if this is worth the price and the hype.  I already knew that Apple's customer service is great, and that alone is worth maybe $150. I do very little on my comp - read the news, write some papers, watch a movie, play chess at Yahoo!, so I do not need it to be a power machine, I simply need it to work. And it does, very well, in fact. Processes are seamless -There is great integration of things like the email client, the Apple store, and iTunes - of which I have NEVER been a fan. I avoid iTunes on my iPhone at all cost - I use Media Monkey instead - But I can see how valuable it is on the notebook. I love how even the websites  and files can be viewed in cover flow.  Apple thinks of "little" but important things like using a charger that is magnetically help in place, so that if you trip on the wire, it disconnects, instead of sending your expensive computer crashing to the floor.  And the fact that I can dual boot was a big selling point, if only so that I do not have to spend $100 to get Microsoft Word, which I will need once I start school again in a few weeks.I have had my MacBook for exactly two weeks, and  I do enjoy it when I can use it, but I have not yet decided if I will keep it. This is because the thing gets so unbearably hot, that it becomes too uncomfortable to use. My first day with this, I set it up, started playing chess through the included app -I was not even online - and within ten minutes, I thought the machine would burn a hole in my pants! I turned it off and ran to my desktop to do some research. And wow - what did I find!Yeah - yeah - I get that Apple says the MacBook should not be used on laps- I get that I should go into Activity Monitor and quit programs that have high CPU - which are NONE - as I am doing very little on the thing in the first place. Yeah - I get that all of the Apple fans out there have this way and that way - some of it costing extra money - to try to help make my computing experience on the MB a more enjoyable one. But this is an experience I should have right out of the box! What other company makes a computer at this price that you cannot use for ten minutes without fearing you will suffer a burn? Now, before the fans come out and say, "Take it back, yours is defective," I will remind you that this problem has been documented all over the Internet. I do not want to hear I should update to Mountain Lion. I have already done the research, and  some are complaining that their MacBook is running even hotter after the update. A co-worker of mine told me that he had a student bring a MacBook to him that had a battery so swollen that the chassis had separated by about 4 inches. Then I thought back to my own iPhone, which had to be replaced in January because of the same expanding battery issue; it split my phone's casing right down the back!How Apple sells these products (with consistent-enough overheating and battery problems) and gets the accolades they do is beyond me. Maybe it is because, other than these very serious flaws, they pioneer very good and exciting technology. You have the fans who will accept any ole shortcoming to remain loyal to what they think is a superior product. Then perhaps there are others who are in my situation, who for the most part really enjoy this MacBook and would love to spend more time learning and using it, but who experience discomfort in just trying to use it for basic computer tasks. This puts me on the fence, as I try to find solutions that do not require my having to dip into my pocket any more to use a computer that simply should not run this hot, especially at this price! If you do not mind the heat and/or are dedicated to spending more money to cool the MacBook, I say go for it.  Even if you are not, but you have been thinking of taking the Apple plunge, I say try the MacBook out for yourself so that you can come to your own conclusion about the overall quality and worthiness of  the MacBook.  As for me, I remain hopeful and very disappointed at the same time.  I soon have to make a decision about returning it, but I have to admit that I really like this machine so much now that the cost bothers me less and less everyday, but that heat... that is a whole different story!UPDATE -10/29/12After taking the comp in and meeting with the folks at Apple, the heating problem has simply resolved itself.  As someone on the Apple forums suggested it would, it just stopped heating up so much and so quickly.  For two months I have used the Mac - and for the most part have liked it.  However, it certainly is not worth this much money, not my money!  The novelty and mystique of the great Mac Book has worn off!There is just too much clicking I have to do to for basic functions like  minimizing a screen and finding files.  What takes 1 click on a Windows computer takes 2 on the Mac Book, what takes 2 on a Windows machine takes 3 on the Mac Book.  Sorry, but it DOES crash, and it crashes as much as any Windows machine I have ever used.  I do not like being forced to use iTunes.  If I had known beforehand that I could not download and use Media Monkey on this, I would not have bought this laptop.  I should be able to decide on the media management software that I want to use.  iTunes is not even very intuitive; rip a CD that is a compilation, and iTunes will not even rip it as ONE CD, rather as a different CD per different artist, and then you have to go in and correct all of the tags so iTunes can properly catalogue your music in its library, and then you have to tell the program to go back and find album art?  Who has time for this? Freeware is a whole lot easier and enjoyable to use, and allows you to use MY music the way I want to!  The Mac Book has stopped being fun for me, and I do not see what it has/does so much more/better than a PC to justify paying twice the price for half the specs of a Windows machine.I have not yet decided if I will sell it; this will be determined by how much I end up paying for a Windows laptop.  With Black Friday coming up, I should be able to get a good price, but if I end up paying more than $500, I will sell the Mac Book.  Never thought I would say that I am looking forward to buying a Windows machine, but Windows 8 is very enticing, at the moment.  The very good thing is that Apple products have great resale value, and my machine is only a few months old and is great cosmetic condition, as well as I have the latest Windows suite installed on it, so I should get a good price for it, if I do sell it.

Reviews.Title: Too early for Screen problems
Reviews.Author: TD
Reviews.Content: i bought this item recently, i havent used it much yesterday when i switched on my macbook pro it attempts to start up i see the white screen, hear the sound, can feel the fans are onthe screen just goes to hibenate and doesnt come on for me to sign on to my mac. after a while it comes on and i am using it playing musicand the screen suddenly hibernates, music is still playing but i have no visual.for an item i havent used much and for what it cost, its too early to start giving problems

Reviews.Title: Bricked after 2ft drop on carpet from bedside.
Reviews.Author: Deimos "."
Reviews.Content: At the title says my pro (which I had running wonderfully with Windows 7 as primary OS as OSX was way to limited) fell off my bed (the cat rubbed against it and pushed it off) and it landed on the carpet.  I didn't have the power cable attached at the time and it landed on it's side, I picked it up and the screen started flickering like crazy then went black.  I was able to get it back but moving the laptop screen back and forth like an idiot and when the stars magically aligned it would work for a min or two then go black again.  After trying this for about a half hour and trying to use this POS with a monitor attached the hard drive failed and I got the contact Apple support grey window (aka mac's Grey screen of death).  I restarted it and it could not boot any partition from my hardrive or even see it.  Let this be more proof that an Apple logo does not mean quality unless it's a IPOD classic that thing can take a beating and work great.  Avoid the chinese slave labour Pro laptop as it's made with cheap unreliable hardware with a super inflated price as is every apple product.  Wake up people. Returned this piece of garbage and bought a 13" Windows 8 ASUS VIVO book, way faster, everything works great, more connectivity, more ports, and just over all a far superior working laptop.

Reviews.Title: Not good
Reviews.Author: Tamlyn M. Hunt "Enjoying"
Reviews.Content: I've owned a bunch of Macs over the last four years, switching over after 20 or so years of PCs. Initially, I loved my 13" Macbook Pro and vowed never to go back to PCs. With my new 15" Macbook Pro, I still won't go back to PCs and in general I really like my Mac, but I no longer love it. I have the new 2012 edition with 750 MB hard drive and 8 GB of RAM. It's quite fast but doesn't seem any where near as fast as it should be based on its rated speed. RAM should not be an issue with 8 GB but it regularly runs out and I have to use 3rd party software to free up RAM, whether I'm editing photos in iPhoto or Aperture or running Final Cut Pro X. It seems that Apple should by now have figured out how to cycle RAM in a way that constantly frees up older allocations and keeps space open for applications being used currently. Seriously.Most egregiously, I'm really pissed off with how computer makers consistently lie about battery life. The 2012 MacBook, as with the few generations before it, advertises a 7 or so hour life under normal use. I find this unconscionably off the mark. My Macs have NEVER lasted more than three hours on one charge under even light usage (Word, web, etc.), and generally last about 2 hours new. This is so far from seven hours I don't know how it's legal to advertise seven hours.Conclusion: I like my Mac (and I really like my Mac desktop), but I expect a lot more from Apple nowadays. Three stars out of five. And I'd appreciate any tips (beyond the obvious) for increasing battery life or managing RAM.Update 10/6: I forgot to add that it gets REALLY hot, to the point where I can't hold it on my lap. This is far hotter than any previous MacBook or Air that I have had has gotten. Even the palmrest gets really hot. This is a major defect that I can't believe Apple allowed.Update 10/20: I've changed this review to two stars because this new allegedly lightning fast MacBook is simply not fast. In fact, it's pretty damn slow and gets hung a lot. It's also started crashing entirely, which has never happened in any of my prior Macs. Crashed twice today in editing with FCP X and I had to force re-boot with the power key. Really disappointed in this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Terrible! Worst decision ever!
Reviews.Author: Jevyn
Reviews.Content: I have had my MacBook pro 13' for around 2 years, And I highly Regret buying it. I do take very good care of my laptop,But these problems have occurred after 2 years (Problems started 6 months after purchase)Bad : My fan is broken, Makes a really loud noise,and never stopMy touchPad Stopped working (Sorta) I have to click things Around 5 times really fast to open them,which is really annoying.bad reliability. Freezes regularly,  When i click things, It won't respond for 5 seconds,and If I clicked it twice then It dose that with a 5 second delay.Can't play games,which sucks,as I am a gamer. Many of the old things that say it is compatible with macBook Pro, Like cameras,Phones,etc, are no longer compatible due to recent updates.Good : Strongest computer ever. Lots of my friends own this same computer,and they are all robustLooks nice. TouchPad fells good after long periods of usePages and keynote are really good.OverAll : Consider if you are a School student, But Be wary, I have owned a few Windows,and the are much better,due to compatibility and a few other reasons.

Reviews.Title: Overall Happy
Reviews.Author: jjt
Reviews.Content: The computer was received on time and just as expected.  The only problem is that the power cord and the battery were defective. We were told to go to the apple store for warranty.

Reviews.Title: it needs more memory
Reviews.Author: William Wilson
Reviews.Content: I had to buy more memory for it it cost me $200I would have boy one with more memoy now I know

Reviews.Title: Great Machine
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: We use our Mac book for home school.  It makes our life much easier.Great deal too!  Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: Great Price for a great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Erik S. Lesser
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal for a decked out MacBook Pro. without the hassle of worrying about auction bidding. The configuration is perfect for my needs.

Reviews.Title: From Pc to MAC.
Reviews.Author: Isaac
Reviews.Content: As a windows user my whole life, i wasnt sure about getting a MAC. I needed something with a good performance as i was sick of my windows laptop and having tried one after another windows laptop but pretty much same outcome i decided to give it a shot to the Mac Book Pro 13 inch.. Its the best, its got the looks, super easy to use and love all you can do with the trackpad!..

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: oscar
Reviews.Content: Best notebook ever.I bought for my job im really exciting for my new gift.Perfect for whatever work. Bye

Reviews.Title: marvelous，gorgeous，splendid and classic
Reviews.Author: weikaihere
Reviews.Content: Apple's produce have been a part of my life. Before the mbpro, I have had a macbook air, iphone and ipad. But when I opened the box, I am excited again. I really cannot find any simple words to show my feeling to apple's design. I linked it to a 27-inch external monitor and built a luxurious working environment. And the price here is also one of the lowest.

Reviews.Title: MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: AP
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal so I can't complain does everything I need it for as far as school goes and I love the speed and easy user interface. Definitely would got the 13 inch with retina display If I had the money though.

Reviews.Title: Great, and good price
Reviews.Author: Jan Rautenbach
Reviews.Content: The onlo issue I have is a noise (sounds like some notification) that comes up intermittently.Even after switching off ALL notifications it still appears.

Reviews.Title: Apple Macbook Pro is the BEST!
Reviews.Author: Mariya M Davis
Reviews.Content: So I had an Apple Macbook that I had gotten though the school in June 2008. Not only was it referbrished/used, but I was paying so much more than a brand new apple macbook pro would of cost. Got ripped off too. Yeah. I should've looked into that more, but I was right out of high school, so I didn't know much. And let's just say my old macbook pro is hunk piece of junk. Everything that went wrong with it did which I won't get too much into, but I wanted a replacement. PC laptops, I wasn't too crazy about, so I decided to go with an updated version of the Macbook Pro.I had to decide between the this and the Retina Display. I wanted the Retina Display one so bad. I think I wanted it mainly because it is thinner than the regular macbook pro, but did I really want to pay $400 more just for that. It did have other features, yes, but I won't pay $1400 for a laptop. I would do a $1000 for a brand new one though. Getting it in the mail is like Christmas! ALl packaged up securely and when I opened it, it was perfect.I had a 4-5 year old macbook pro. So there were some pretty big changes that I am still getting use to. The trackpad is a little confusing, it scrolls in opposite directions and you can click anyway in there. I think that's the biggest thing I have to use to. It is smaller in size, like weight like, I'm talking about. Love the black keyboard with the lighting. Finally I have photo booth again! I missed it. I am still basically messing around with it, but I remain in love with it.I have had my ups and downs with Apple products in the past, but honestly apple remains to be the best in my opinion. Everything is just so beautiful about their products. Since this one is brand new, I'm going to take care of it like it's my baby.

Reviews.Title: Very fast!
Reviews.Author: iciaviator
Reviews.Content: I can't rate this item at this time, I can say so far so good. I can tell that it is faster than previous computers I've owned. I do need to get more familiar with it!

Reviews.Title: Best computer ever
Reviews.Author: Barbara A. Moe
Reviews.Content: I am so glad to be back with a Mac as my computer!  I had 2 Macs before my daughter convinced me to go to a PC.  I have not been having trouble with viruses like with the PCs.  It has been good to get back working on my genealogy again, which I can do because I could intall Reunion.  I have always appreciated the features the Mac has offered and now with my new laptop and it's updates, I am thrilled.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: Didn't understand what the fuss was all about... now I do. Coming from a windows world, I had to learn a few things but its worth it. This machine rocks! I've been using it for a few days now. Everything is just smooth... From web development to watching DVDs. My mum was so impressed, she ordered one for herself!

Reviews.Title: have not used much, but am satisfied with purchase
Reviews.Author: G. A. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer to utilize in making "trailers" and short clips for PR purposes.  I think that with a good computer the sky is the limit.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT $ REAL
Reviews.Author: cool shopper
Reviews.Content: i didnt get it from here i got my mac from SHOPNBC  but i had to putt  a review every where possible this thing is amazing you should  have this

Reviews.Title: I am typing on it as we Speak
Reviews.Author: Sean A Newman
Reviews.Content: Here I am a month into using the computer and I can safely say it is the best computer I've ever had. Everything is just as expected from Apple.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: elias
Reviews.Content: excellent product. Apple sofware and exterior ist beautiful. I am much into technology but in my level of awareness i can say that i cannot imagine anything better than this

Reviews.Title: It an Apple what else can I say
Reviews.Author: M. Lutchmedial
Reviews.Content: The is the second Apple computer I ever own. The first was a Apple 2E (I believe from 1985) . I bought it to play the Akai Pro APC40 Ableton Controller and it work very nice.It is fast in running the number of applications I use it for. The body is very durable and the battery far out last longer than the HP laptop I presently have. It never crash or give trouble since I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome computer
Reviews.Author: Carlos Marin
Reviews.Content: I finally change from PC and i dont regret about it, it has everything you need, pretty easy to use. love it

Reviews.Title: nothing to report
Reviews.Author: Kostas Papazoglou
Reviews.Content: All went well and am happy to say it since this is ridiculous to do just to say im sotisfied

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Les Roque "Les R"
Reviews.Content: My merchandise arrived very quickly just days after I put my order in even during the Christmas rush..I am a very happy camper today....

Reviews.Title: Excelente!
Reviews.Author: JULIO ""VILLA""
Reviews.Content: Excelente Calidad del Producto y Buen Precio para Comparar. Tiempo de Entrega en Orden. Esta es una de mis marcas preferidas.

Reviews.Title: MACBOOK!!
Reviews.Author: Raffy
Reviews.Content: i really love this mac book. it's my first mac book pro. I love using windows and i wanted to try mac. I like this laptop but the battery is bad.  THE BATTERY WONT LAST LONG.

Reviews.Title: MY FIRST MAC
Reviews.Author: angie
Reviews.Content: THIS IS MY FIRST MAC I AM AN ARCHITECTURE STUDENT AND SO FAR SO GOOD IT HAS BEEN A GREAT LAPTOP IT IS FAST BEAUTIFUL, I AM STILL LEARNING TO USE IT SINCE I HAVE ALWAYS WORKED ON WINDOWS, BUT IT IS EASY AND NICE!!!

Reviews.Title: 2012 MacBook Pro
Reviews.Author: Book girl
Reviews.Content: This is my first Mac.....why did I wait so long!!  I have been a PC user since 1995 and always thought it was the best and easiest to use.  I see I was wrong after using my new Mac.  Everything so far has been much easier to use.  I still don't know everything I need to know about my Mac, but I learn something new every day I use it.  I am not a bit sorry I have switched from windows to a Mac.  I am very happy that I did!  Do not be afraid to buy one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop for the Price
Reviews.Author: Simba4runner
Reviews.Content: I hadn't had a Mac Computer other than a IPAD, IPOD touch for a LONG time.  When I saw this product and the price I said I had purchase the laptop.  I love it.  It's so much fun to sit on my couch at night.  I highly recommend a MAC laptop.  This version is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Love this laptop
Reviews.Author: Xan Ha
Reviews.Content: I am love Apple and all products, bought iPhone, iPad, Macbook air and Macbook pro. All are great ^^. It is the best laptop on this time, MBP retina much expensive with me ^^

Reviews.Title: Great Travel laptop
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: This is good for me when I travel, the size is good and it always fits on the drop down trays. I miss the older mouse pad with the 2 buttons, I find that it's a pain to scroll up sometimes. Other than that, it's a great laptop.

Reviews.Title: Good bye PC!!!!
Reviews.Author: Victor Perez
Reviews.Content: This is a great starter Macbook Pro. I absolutely love this machine. The screen size its just enough and  light enough to be extremely portable.I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Maria Barriga
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to switch frm oc to Mac, but after 2 weeks I was not so happy cause my new Mac kept freezing!  So I took it to the apple store and turns out it had the wrong iOs, they try fixing it and after changing it and upgrading to Mountain Lion it still freezes! So they basically told me to send it back and get a new one! My 30 days are up tomorrow, I started the return presses today outside the apple store I just hope I get a new one soon before school starts!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: I switched from years of using PCs to Apple just to see what all the buzz was about.  I consider that the costliest mistake I've ever made.  The computers are too expensive and their CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE WORST IN THE INDUSTRY.  Before you buy any products, read the online reviews about their service....the high price isn't just for the hardware...and when their product is defective, they won't send a replacement overnight...you have to wait 5-7 business days for standard shipping.

Reviews.Title: A complete failure
Reviews.Author: yaya
Reviews.Content: The item shipped different from what advertised and I had to pay for the the return shipment not fair at all!

Reviews.Title: A lemon not an Apple.
Reviews.Author: dave "dave"
Reviews.Content: I had this one day. It has been in the shop counting today 16 days. Will not migrate over iTunes from my other computer. Will not run my movie data base program. These are the only two programs I wanted it to run. It will run all but both of the programs I need. It had been in the shop so long now that I can't return it to Apple. Now I'm stuck with this LEMON.

Reviews.Title: WARNING - READ BEFORE YOU BUY APPLE
Reviews.Author: Frank Erfurth
Reviews.Content: If you are purchasing an Apple computer for ease of use and a super user-friendly GUI, go ahead and push "BUY IT NOW".  But if you are migrating over to Apple to take advantage of the apparent bargains to be found in the professional software arena (Music Production, Video Production, Graphic Arts, etc.) I am issuing a warning that Apple is lying to you.  Apple has implemented an aberrant pricing policy that varies widely from the industry standard pricing policy for professional software.  Apple, in true corporate fashion, has made this change without warning or notice.  The new policy is NO PATH TO UPGRADE.  You heard me right.  If you pay professional software prices for a piece of Apple software, and two months later they release the new and improved package, you will be stuck paying full price for the upgrade.  Do you feel like you got a deal now?  You have now paid more for your software than if you had gone with the industry leading software package (PreSONUS, Adobe Premiere, CorelDraw, etc.) and next update, you will be well behind the pricing curve.  I do not have a problem with Apple software, but rather the sneaky way in which they implemented the pricing policy.  If you are buying Apple to take advantage of these apparent deals...save your money and stick with a PC.  You will pay more initially for your software, but within a year you will be saving money.

Reviews.Title: with minor problem
Reviews.Author: sad face
Reviews.Content: with few minor problem connecting with my wifi(took me more than an hour to talk to my wifi customer service, everything is fine. It was delivered on time, packaging was okay.

Reviews.Title: The laptop is not as fast as I expected
Reviews.Author: Zhen Gong "Jane"
Reviews.Content: The laptop is okay. Not as fast as I tried in Apple store. Apple's battery and screen is so much better than PC.

Reviews.Title: Apple products use to be more reliable
Reviews.Author: J. Dionne
Reviews.Content: After using this MacBook Pro for a little over thirty days, I have lost complete access to my very expensive (by comparison) notebook.The notebook worked well for roughly 30 days after I received the MacBook, installed all the updates Apple Store informed me to install and Apple's "Parallels" Windoze bridge VM to read/create Word/Excel documents.  Then, after an Apple Store update, the system started panicking during a normal "Shutdown."  I submitted all "reports" the MacBook Pro asked I booted back up for about a week.Then, after yet another panic during shutdown the MacBook Pro was rebooted, the user and passwords prompt would no longer recognize ASCII keyboard characters, i.e. a-Z, A-Z, 0-9, etc.  It would, however, allow me to enter Ctr-A through Ctrl-Z, and Alt-A through Alt-Z, just not A-Z and numeric keyboard keys are not be recognized.  I opened a Apple Support ticket, but they are clueless, with two representatives provided divergent  advise.I don't know if I just got a lemming, or if this is a know BUG in Apple OSX.  The only good comments I can say about Apple Support is that they immediately take inbound calls and keep to their call back schedules.  The bad news, they seem unable to correct any but the most simplest, generic issues like a novice computer user's question as to "where the any key" is located.  (I am a thirty year plus hardware, network and software engineer.)*UPDATE*05-19-2013: After spending my entire Saturday either talking with a CS rep or downloading an update from Apple I can report that Apple technical support was able to fix my issue.  The exact cause of the failure remains elusive, but after being escalated up to higher, more experienced technicians I am once again happily using my Macbook Pro.  Stuff happens and it is never fun when it happens to ourselves, but with patience and persistence one shall always prevail.

Reviews.Title: Review on MacBook Pro w/ retina display 13.3-Inch
Reviews.Author: Kavita
Reviews.Content: I've wanted a MacBook Pro for a while now and I love it! I was planning on getting it from the Apple store but realized that it's better to get it on Amazon because my Chase Freedom card allows 5% back on Amazon purchases. If you're looking for a good quality computer that doesn't over heat, has tons of space for pictures and documents, and has a great battery life; I recommend this one. I ended up getting the MacBook Pro with retina display and more storage space because I don't want to have to back up my computer if it crashes for some reason. Also, if you're a person who makes videos on YouTube, more space is definitely needed! Overall, I love my MacBook Pro and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Like brand-new. It met my expectations more than enough! I love it!! Shipping was fast, item was extremly how it was described!!
Reviews.Author: Dilara
Reviews.Content: It met my expectations more than enough! I love it!! Shipping was fast, item was extremely how it was described!! I've been using macbook for 6 years and I cannot imagine I use windows. As a media student, I can use all the applications that I need.

Reviews.Title: Now we're an Apple family
Reviews.Author: FACory
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have each dumped the HP laptops and moved to Apple Workbooks.  There is no comparison.  The Apple runs so efficiently and effortless, and did I mention - FASTER than the PC.  My wife had hers for two years before I just got mine.  She finally convinced me that MAC was better.  I believed her after both HP's crashed within a few weeks of each other.  Never again.  Apple is the only way to go.

Reviews.Title: Works good now
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: When I first got the computer, I noticed the tracking pad was hard to click.  This was my first Mac so I wasn't familiar with how it was suppose to feel.  After using my friend's computer I knew something was wrong.I took my Macbook to the Apple store and they had to replace the battery after 1 month of use since it was swelling.  They tried to tell me that the battery wasn't covered by the warranty and it costs about $150 to replace. They ended up not charging me.Other than that battery issue and the battery life does not last too long, I'm pretty happy with the computer.

Reviews.Title: good but...
Reviews.Author: tarheel
Reviews.Content: I love apple products and was excited to get my new computer. However, once I upgraded to ML, my computer has been freezing sporadically - especially when I have multiple windows open. I've been reading online and this seems to be a common problem.  This is NOT supposed to happened. My old mac never crashed randomly. I am very disappointed. I have a few days left, and I think I'm going to return this computer. Apple needs to provide a solution asap. I don't think it's the hardware, but still. I wish I could buy this new computer but have it run SL, which was actually pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with performance
Reviews.Author: Alewis
Reviews.Content: So far I have had this laptop for a few weeks but it works quite well. The packaging was fine and the delivery was very speedy. Overall, I am pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: first mac
Reviews.Author: Constantin
Reviews.Content: The MACBOOK PRO is great, i do have an issue with the CAPS LOCK button that doesn't work at every touch and i need to press it harder than i'm normally used to on a regular PC that is much cheeper. Apple please look into this....

Reviews.Title: $2,000 Paperweight
Reviews.Author: Former Mac Addict
Reviews.Content: I have had Macs for years, and have always been happy with them, but this new version of MacBook Pro, and the new OS Mountain Lion is a lemon!  If you plan to connect to the internet via wireless, you are in big trouble with this computer.  The Macbook Pros have a fatal flaw in that they cannot reliably open and maintain a connection to the internet on any wireless router that has WEP security.  After trying and failing countless times to connect my brand new computer to the internet, the Apple support recommended I "call my service provider and ask them to change to WPA!" Yet, 2 other computers, an older Mac and a PC have no problems with this Wifi set up! I travel all over the U.S.A. and Canada with my laptop and cannot control every service provider, thus this computer is useless to me! Apple refuses to acknowledge this problem, that has made so many Macbook Pro owners dissatisfied with their machines, despite thousands of complaints similar to mine on their very own Apple Support discussion boards and extensive complaints online. Don't buy this laptop unless you will not be using wireless connections to the internet.

Reviews.Title: Lenovo is better!!
Reviews.Author: Gail Foresman
Reviews.Content: I was sorry I purchased the product as soon as I brought it home.  I was replacing my Lenovo, and even though we had had trouble with Apple before, I tried them once again.  This computer's mouse was frozen in the same spot for two months until we sent it back!  Always buy from the trusted brand- Lenovo!

Reviews.Title: Sooo anyway
Reviews.Author: Mark E. Reinhardt
Reviews.Content: Well, based on all the reviews, I picked this one up. Taking it home..a long drive out, and into the city, I fired it up. First and foremost, it is Gorgeous! Talk about build quality, it is indeed lights out!!! Get the wireless mouse too...it is as well crazy!!!Now having said that, my jittery, 3 shots a day type diabetes for forever  20 plus years......I couldn't stand the miniscule buttons on the task bar! About the size of a pin head. It Did not work. Talk about frustrating! Having given it the weekend to play with, it reaffirmed my faith that it was not for me. Really really! So I had to drive back into the city/BB, I exchanged it for a HP ENVY at a similar price point. Well...getting it home ( and after hearing so much bad about windows 8), I have laptop LOVE!  The touchscreen....it looks like the Apple OS, but does things faster, easier, and intuitive, and is alot faster than my initial startup on the Mac Pro.... Kinda Gentle....If you are going to drop a big dime.....Think carefully.  Another of my issues was that I wanted to transfer my DOS stuff from XP...Pics, music  and soforth...wasn't sure about about Mac....Those tiny buttons tho were the deal killer.Good luck in your search....I have Kumbyaaa in my house....:)Good luckMark

Reviews.Title: Great Computer, as always....
Reviews.Author: buysALot
Reviews.Content: my review is to commend apple on another amazing product. 3 stars is because of the horrible way amazon sent me my delivery. My first attempt at posting this was rejected by amazon, hopefully this one makes it. I think its smart to warn customers not to buy a $2000 laptop that gets delivered in a ripped box with popped bubble wrap inside.

Reviews.Title: So far so Good
Reviews.Author: p
Reviews.Content: so far I really haven't had any problems with the macbook. It is taking me a bit to get use too though. I have never used a laptop or a mac before. I am learning and finding that I like the product quite a bit. I should be asked in about 6 months then I will know more about it and have better comments. It will serve me well for quite sometime I believe.

Reviews.Title: Bought two of these, gotta love amazon!
Reviews.Author: Sohail Khan
Reviews.Content: I bought one in august for my friend and then one this month for myself.  Basically, Amazon rocks and Macbooks are awesome.  The two go hand in hand.

Reviews.Title: Love this Macbook
Reviews.Author: Poodlegirl "silly yak"
Reviews.Content: I found this computer easy to use, very fast, and has a million  fun features that I have only begun to explore. We are already thinking of buying another for my husband.

Reviews.Title: Mac Book Pro
Reviews.Author: Max Jack
Reviews.Content: Arrived early, easy to setup.  Added memory (very easy).  Loaded programs and away I go.  Nothing negative to report.  A great buy.

Reviews.Title: Unusable as a work computer
Reviews.Author: Erik R. Johnsen
Reviews.Content: I'm a designer turned front-end developer and this computer is unusable for front-end development. I have a production PC which was much less expensive and way underspeced compared to this Mac. Opening photoshop takes FOooooooRRREVER, as do all programs that do not begin with an 'i'. The free upgrade to Mountain Lion FAILED. FAILED. It tried to boot up and the screen just flashed over and over and over again. Before and after I resolved that issue, I saw the damn "beachball" all the time as the computer tries to figure out what the hell it's doing while I wait for it. I spend so much time waiting for it. Although its display is bright and vibrant the OS so unusable for work, I have moved back to the older, and still over performing PC. The only thing I use this computer for is a Safari tester, and Safari is awful compared to Chrome. I can't believe people like these computers. Now that they are not virus free ([...]l) I see absolutely no benefit to Apple products as they are slower, more expensive, and do not last as long.

Reviews.Title: not bad for a little refresh
Reviews.Author: J. Garbi
Reviews.Content: My first impressions:I used to own a unibody (2009) core2duo. Theres about few major differences from the upgrade that I noticed.First the fan noise. I light whisper. My old device had no sound at all, but suffered from heat issues watching flash videos, then when stressed more the fan would get very loud. However this new model (which may be similar to the i5 series CPU) runs cool and more constant. I suspect its fan is different it idles at 2000rpm.The CPU,  the difference isn't always apparent but does perform well so far and is noticeable watching videos. Ill need to play with it more before i can really say more. Originally I had interest in a MacBook air but didn't want to get an even weaker device than the base series pro,  since apples products are underpowered to begin with and I recall the AIR isn't user upgradable (unless I'm wrong?) I felt this model was best. And I could most likely upgrade ram to 16gb (still have to confirm this is possible on this release)Lastly battery sustains itself ever so slightly better. My older device battery health hardly deteriorated (4%) and this guy seems to cruise smoothly without significant drain.

Reviews.Title: didnt like
Reviews.Author: swanson
Reviews.Content: i like widows better, i had to return it....... if you like apple software then i would recommend seems ok

Reviews.Title: Macbook
Reviews.Author: Kyle Jillson
Reviews.Content: This laptop arrived very quickly, and has been running since. Very lightweight and nonbulky, yet powerful enough to function like a normal laptop.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding screen resolution
Reviews.Author: Parker Hallam
Reviews.Content: I wanted to gift my wife a laptop, she is a software professional and her existing laptop is giving her problems. This time I wanted to go for Apple product and started my search in that direction. After going through a number of online shopping sites I came to a conclusion that Amazon is the best as I am quite familiar with their services. The Apple MacBook Pro was delivered on time. My wife is very pleased with the gift. As I was probing through the MacBook Pro I came to know that it has some superior features that I don't find on my laptop.The most amazing feature is that the Thunderbolt OS allows data transfer at the rate of 10GBps. The design is outstanding. I was glad to notice that it came with 7 hours of battery life. Though this is the first time I am trying a Mac OS I did not find anything unusual.

Reviews.Title: repair service sucks
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: If it was possible to give them 0 start, I would have done it.My Laptop's one of the Key from keyboard came out and it was mechanical failure.My laptop was under coverage but when I gave it to them for repairs, they quoted me $755 for it.this company just wants customers' money in their pocket.they dont care how you feel when they charge you hundreds of hard earned dollars.I wish this company to go bust.I will never ever buy any apple product in my life.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing for the money. Worst of all my Apple computers, and I own all of them
Reviews.Author: VeritasluxMea "Neoplatonic Platonist"
Reviews.Content: This is a new post mid-2012 Macbook pro non-retina, purchased it on sale new best buy. Owning everything Apple owns, and having my older macbook side by side, and my new Mac Air beside it as well, and after endless adjustments in brightness and contrast, there is no doubt the screen used on the macbook pro non-retina is inferior to my MacAir and macbook.Apple uses Samsung and LG on their monitors on the same model, both in the Retina MBP and non-retina, but they dont advertise this fact. As of 3/19/2013 Apple is being sued over the 'secret' that MBP retina use either LG or Samsung, but you dont know which one youre getting until you notice bad ghosting on the screen (which is the LG problem, not found on the Samsung). Its sad that you 'roll the dice' on WHO made your monitor on two MBP exact same model and mfg. date. That is something Apple should've known would soon rear its head like a snake in the night.Foremostly I must comment that I own Apple stock, and own tons of their products and sing their praises to no end, as such I am not an 'apple hater' by any stretch. I am shocked at how fuzzy, and flat the screen is on this MBP, and wonder WHO made the monitor on this laptop, since you never know, and Apple isnt saying, and they wont tell you, nor is it indicated on the box WHO made the monitor, since Apple uses multiple suppliers for the SAME MAC models.I am returning this unit for a refund, the screen is rather painful to read and type on, ...and since I use 7 different computers, I am not 'addicted to one type of screen', and am adjusted to many, ...but this unit is painfully unbearable.Side by side, believe it or not, BUT TRUE, the speakers on my Mac Air crank out crisper and MUCH LOUDER at full on same tunes than this MBP does. This isnt subjective or conjecture is rock hard FACT. You would think just the opposite on the larger MBP, but thats a fact.Another minus is the squishy jello-keyboard touch, a really undesirable (generally to most who hate this) feature.Ive read a lot of INSANE comments by others rebuking others saying "my mac air is better than this MBP". Well heres two empirical facts, all the upgrades money can buy: SSD, mem, etc, WILL NOT change the 'stink-factor' of the screen on this MBP, or the squishy keyboard, OR the inferior speaker output.Yes, the optical drive is nice (no bluray, shame on apple for po-pooing optical drives), and the ethernet, but the mac air is about as lite as an ipad and does 90% of what this Mac Pro does,...so the math is simple.The only negative against this unit is the same as ALL Apple computers, that being Apple is insanely stingy on memory. There is not any Apple product that doesnt immediately need a Mem upgrade. Given the extremely high price of all Apple laptops etc, the pathetic lack of memory is morbidly sad.Barring the horribly bad screen, and nasty squishy keyboard feedback, the unit is fast and well built, but for its price, etc, the mac air is far far moreso a desirable product. Endless speed tests show negligible difference side by side over many apps and overloading between the two on a year older Mac Air.

Reviews.Title: Battery doesn't last even 4 hours..
Reviews.Author: Lautaro Carbia
Reviews.Content: As i said, theres huge battery problems unresolved. I was between a Sony Vaio since im a owner of an old version and it great.. if you are wondering whether to buy a Macbook Pro for the first time I wouldnt recommend ir at all. Apple is looking in the other direction when it comes to trouble..

Reviews.Title: can't open several times
Reviews.Author: Ding
Reviews.Content: I just got it three days ago and was very excited. However, last night it cannot be opened. The power just shined a little while than went out. Although it finally worked, I was't sure what is wrong with it and how I can check it, in apple store or amazon?Besides, I tried to install Windows with boot camp, but after a whole night, the progress cannot be done...

Reviews.Title: Ripped off
Reviews.Author: Bossmen
Reviews.Content: How I ordered this Mac book pro it came clean everything new well that's how it looked.. I barley used it never left the house I was trying to save it till January which is when my semester starts n ill need it most..well I wake up today and finally open my MacBook Pro to use it  and the screen looks like a tv on with no cable static every were. I even tried to hold the shut down button down and it won't turn of at all so it's staying on till the battery drain basically..I believe I was told I got a new one but u guys sold me a used one..how can something get messed up so quick worth so much

Reviews.Title: BAD MOTHER TRUCKA
Reviews.Author: thaman
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student. I was trying to decide between Mac and PC for awhile. Finally, forked up a little extra and got the Mac. WOW! If you want a dependable, fast, and cool computer nothing beats the mac. You won't regret it. Everyone is swapping to Mac too. If you're going to college to be anything other than an engineer then go with the Mac. My roommate loves my Mac but says they suck for programming. Who knows it could be total BS.At the end of day the track pad is freaking amazing. Also, lets say a good looking girl comes in class and sees two open seats. One is by a guy with Macbook and one is by a guy with a pc. Who do you think she is going to sit by? Definitely the guy with the Mac$$$ what more do you need to know Mac=hot girlsP.S. I had to download an online software for one of my classes. It took my friend a couple hours to download it on his PC. It took me maybe 10 minutes. I have had several pc's (dell, toshiba, acer, gateway, samsung) and nothing compares to this beast.

Reviews.Title: Amazon price not comptitive
Reviews.Author: TutankhamenIV
Reviews.Content: So far the computer runs fine and has no problems. I am still transitioning from being a PC user to a mac user and I like the gestures feature on the trackpad. What I am not satisfied with is that Amazon did not have competitive price for this Macbook. I have always trusted Amazon for the lowest price, so much so that I stopped comparing prices around. However, 3 days after purchasing this Macbook Pro, I found the exact same macbook in Frys for more than $100 less! It taught me to compare prices before purchasing anything from Amazon in future!

Reviews.Title: Apple MacBook Pro MD101LL/A 13.3-Inch Laptop (NEWEST VERSION)
Reviews.Author: Rovshan Abbasov
Reviews.Content: I like it. Perfect deal!There were small problems with Mac office. But now it is running well.Probably I will order another mac for my son.

Reviews.Title: Over estimated laptop.
Reviews.Author: Songhai
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews on this laptop pushed my expectations way  out of this world.I am comparing it with my Toshiba laptop.1.It is not faster than my 3 years old Toshiba Satellite E205 S1904 Laptop which cost me $100.00 less.2.The Keyboard of my Toshiba is as responsive as the keyboard of the Mac Pro, if not better.3.The Toshiba Keyboard is better lit than the Keyboard of the Mac Pro.The Mac Pro lit key board is just showmanship.Light is reflected around the edges of the letters and not through the letters as in the Toshiba.4.My Toshiba weighs 5Ibs and the Mac Pro is listed as weighing 4.5Ibs, yet the Toshiba feels lighter.5.My Toshiba laptop does not keep stains while the Mac Pro laptop is a stain attractant.6.My Toshiba is cooler than the Mac Pro when left running for hours.7.My Toshiba laptop is as quiet as the Mac Pro but when the Mac Pro revs up the fan speed, my Toshiba is quieter.My only pros for the Mac Pro are :1.Longer battery life of 6+ hours while the Toshiba is 2.5hours.2.I do not play video games but I hear that the Mac Pro is good for gaming.Though I have not checked it out, I give this point to Mac Pro.3.No need for antivirus software as opposed to my windows 7 based Toshiba laptop which has one.The Mac Pro is a decent laptop but not an extra ordinary laptop as these reviews would want you to believe.I am giving it a 3 stars because I do not think it surpasses my Toshiba laptop which I rate as 4 stars (-1 star for very short battery life of 2.5hrs).

Reviews.Title: Apple Macbook
Reviews.Author: Peanut
Reviews.Content: My older son talked his younger brother into getting a macbook to replace his 2.5 year old laptop that was giving him problems again.

Reviews.Title: buen producto.

Reviews.Content: Excelente producto.. rápido puede correr los juegos nuevos con recursos medios. portable y muy comada.. al usarla al extremo se calienta algo.se nota calidad al compararla con una hp, dell, etc.

Reviews.Content: Awesome,love it. My first one! THE IMAGES ARE CRISP AND NOT HAVING TO WORRY ABOUT VIRUS IS GREAT. LlllllllllllllaNow is the time foe all good men to come to the aid of their country. Handicapped. Hate writing more than necessary.

Reviews.Title: GREATEST COMPUTER EVER
Reviews.Author: Judith A. Frey
Reviews.Content: THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO BETTER COMPUTER ON THE MARKET.  IT IS BY FAR THE BEST.  THERE IS JUST SO MANY WONDERFUL THINGS ABOUT IT.  LOVE LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Awesome computer
Reviews.Author: J.Gamble
Reviews.Content: This Macbook Pro is AMAZING! If you are afraid of it not having a disc player please don't be. After not having a disc player I have actually noticed that I never used this disc play in my old laptop either. However if you really need a disc player Apple sells one that connects to your USB port. I love the new high retina display, and because this computer lacks a disc player it makes it significantly lighter. Overall, this is a fast, light, practical computer and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Worst laptop purchase I've ever made.
Reviews.Author: O.P.T. "O.P.T."
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying this is about my fourth or fifth MBP I've owned.  The ones before it worked flawlessly.  I thought I was "upgrading" to this machine but I was WRONG.  Boy was I wrong.  The changes that came along with Mountain Lion are downright horrific to the point that I'm ready to throw this thing against the wall.  I am SO frustrated with this messy, imprecise, unpredictable user experience!  So what sucks about it?--Now when you scroll on a webpage more than two or three times, the page will begin scrolling EXTREMELY fast causing you to lose your place and have to backtrack to try and find it.  Scroll a couple more times and it happens AGAIN.  This is f'ing maddening.  What's even more maddening is that this has been forced upon us with no option to turn it off!  I've called Applecare about it multiple times now and I'm told it's a "design feature."  WELL IT SUCKS!  Supposedly it's to mimic how an iPhone works?  I don't know, as I don't own an iPhone--but I do know one thing!  I DON'T WANT MY LAPTOP ACTING LIKE A F'ING IPHONE!!!--Rubber-banding effect on webpages.  This is where the webpage (or folder, etc) will stretch beyond its boundaries and then "snap back."  Now this wouldn't be a big deal if the rubber-banding only occurred on the tops and bottoms of webpages, but Apple has also decided to implement it on the SIDES of webpages.  This causes webpages to slip and slide all over the f'ing place, making it extremely annoying when trying to read text while scrolling!  Again, no way to turn this "design feature" off!--Apple has also decided to change all the trackpad gestures, and not for the better.  AGAIN!!!!  No ability to revert them back to what they were in Snow Leopard.  Seriously--how hard would it be for Apple to simple offer an option to use the older, more familiar settings for these sorts of things?  I did manage to set my frontward/backward webpage settings to three-finger swipe like I'm accustomed to from SL.  Cool!  Ummm, too bad it barely works!  Half the time the trackpad is completely unresponsive when using this gesture.  How.  F'ing.  Obnoxious.I am racking my brain trying to figure out a way to get RID of this thing and go back to an older MBP running Snow Leopard (which was NEVER broken so I'm not sure why Apple went and tried to fix it!)  Unfortunately if I return it, I'll be slapped with hefty a restocking fee.  And I don't have the conscience to pawn this hunk of junk off on someone else.  I have never in my life regretted an "upgrade" like I have with this purchase.  I have learned the hard way: Newer does NOT always mean better!!!  If I wanted a frustrating user experience I would have simply purchased a $279 Toshiba running Windows!!!  I will not rest until I get rid of this computer or Apple fixes their annoying "design features" which do nothing but infuriate me and many others!

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: G. Xu
Reviews.Content: Got this as a gift from my wife.  very excited cuz it is my first Apple product.now just used less than 3 month. it stopped working.  black screen after power on.  need to send to repair.

Reviews.Title: Out there in never, never land!
Reviews.Author: James B Hawkins
Reviews.Content: I don't know how I will like it - after over two weeks of waiting for the laptop it still is out there in pony express land!  Evidently  Amazon 'Prime' doesn't apply to deliveries!

Reviews.Title: I love my Macbook Pro
Reviews.Author: adrakephoto
Reviews.Content: I love everything about my macbook.  I will never own a different brand for my photography business as well as for my own personal use.  The performance is unsurpassed in comparison to any other PC system I've ever used.

Reviews.Title: FRUSTRATION
Reviews.Author: Aron Fox
Reviews.Content: This is my first Mac experience, being fed up with pc's.  Firstly, there is ZERO documentation. I could not discover how to get to desktop, so I had to call for help to accomplish this simple task. The screen insisted that I explore the voiceover feature instead. Next, the Macbook Pro insisted that I accomplish "migration" of pc files before I get to use it in any way. How am I supposed to know about such things? Anyone's guess!But the worst part of all is that no help tutorial files can be opened and watched for any apps-NONE!After many hours with the so-called help, nothing. They are absolutely clueless as to why those help files cannot be opened. They said that it is Hughesnet's fault. Hughesnet says it's Apples fault. I am the one in the middle with a non-functioning computer. I only have 14 days to get this fixed or this piece of $#!! is mine.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced, "You no say!"

Reviews.Content: Well, it is a very good notebook, specially for mac fans. But something I don't like is how it is insanely overpriced.The components that it has don't cost more than $600 dollars... (Considering all of it, screen, keyboard, all)If you are searching for something as fast, but way less expensive go for an outstanding Windows notebook, but then again, if you were considering buying this, then buy a $1000 dollars notebook, not an $400 dollars one. Because many users say Windows is bad, as they buy $200-$300 dollar Notebooks.Now if cash is not a problem for you, then just go experience Windows 8 and Mountain Lion OS, as you just need to know which ones fits you better.

Reviews.Title: NIce
Reviews.Author: Sheng
Reviews.Content: I was woke up by my brother with a package from amazon and was really confused first. Really pleased with my new macbook, but was really surprised by its weight

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with Macintosh products.  In fact I am completely frustrated.  I have had the Macbook Pro for 1 1/2 years and I have found that it crashes as much as Windows.  Also, many software programs are not compatible with the IOS platform.  Luckily I still have a windows based computer to use when needed.  I will be going back to Windows when I replace this laptop. NEVER AGAIN WILL I EVER BUY A POS LIKE THESE MAC'S.

Reviews.Title: Missing In Action
Reviews.Author: techdirector
Reviews.Content: I waited and waited for this product and never received it. I was put off by the owner and when I checked the UPS tracking number it had never been sent. I did receive a credit... but I had to wait for that also. I will never attempt to buy anything from them again.

Reviews.Title: How are they still in business
Reviews.Author: IT Admin "Microsoft Bob"
Reviews.Content: First let me say this Mac was a gift. Second let me say not really.I hate it so much I wouldn't even give it to you if I hated you.First I wiped this device and installed a clean version. Then I updated. You know the low cost updates Apple puts out. Seriously I had to leave it running overnight on the update.It has been nothing but problems. Every update breaks something and not I am not kidding. Mostly they break their own tools or apps.I updated the software on a clean install, then update iTunes, cool yeah. Wrong.  iTunes needs quicktime version blah blah error starts popping up. Only that version is installed and I'm not using iTunes.Then I update the OS to the newest version only to see its killed Cisco VPN permanently. I don't mean the client I mean it removed the parameters in networking to allow connections. And it broke the web version of Cisco Anyconnect which you have to buy and its not cheap. My Apple support friends at Boeing have asked me how I fixed it. I look on websites forApple and they are dumber than crowbars so I happen to see a 64 bit mentioned and I decide to search for a Cisco 64 bit client and install it. Works again only I am running 32bit OSX nice. Then I try to update again to the best yet from Apple low and behold I'm told to buy it from the store. Only I have to have the newer version to download from the store. Apple intellect at its best.After a phone call and some money I have a cd on the way.  I install the next version, setup a printer, setup office, configure email, and install a couple other items nothing major though.Installed updates 1GB worth and bam the printer is dead. Of course on windows you can delete, or change/view the network settings, and reinstall in a minute. On a mac you need another 1.5 GB install. The cool thing is how you download the installer and it expands it and moves the files to various other locations. Sheer genius to take a download file, extract it to a .pkg file, then scatter files all over the hard drive so you cant possibly just go back to the download location to reinstall.  Now I suppose their is some script I could run but I can't even find the install using Apple guidelines from the OS. Not even using the help from from forums.Anyone that says a mac is easy is lying. Every update you run the prospect of losing hardware settings, programs you bought may no longer work, and you might even have a paper weight.The issues I have had are not hardware problems. I installed another harddrive, installed Windows XP and no issues, wiped it and installed windows 7 and both were faster and more stable.If all your going to do is browse the web and use iTunes you might be okay other than that they are junk. I have built a non standard Windows 2008 server on a Dell desktop and had to hack network card drivers and it runs fine, wiped a virus off a kids pc, did a complete reinstall of Vista without drivers on an older pc and spent less time than on this mac. I have had it two months and its been used about 12 times,  I have ins talled windows XP\windows 3.1\95\95\windows 7 and updated thousands of times and even the worst pc I have had, has never given me this much grief. This is the reason MS sold 60 million copies of XP, over 60 million copies of Windows 7 and Apple has sold 3 million mountain lion operating systems. And Apple charges $15 and Windows charges between $100-$300 per copy.If you buy a new computer every 3-6 months Apple is for you. The first couple updates will render it a paper weight and then you can get a new one and they will give you an $8 trade in credit too! As for the folks at the store helping you I would say yes they will if you forgot how to plug it in. If it involves tech support you better hope you have some good diagnostic skills. I usedto think I did before I got this mac.I got this laptop for troubleshooting and to become familiar so I could assist others. It has taken more research than my degree and let me tell you it certainly has help me learn how to troubleshoot macs.Now I know why few vendors make software for macs. It's not because Mac doesn't license them its because of poor/incomplete development at Apple.

Reviews.Title: in the apple store
Reviews.Author: waiting
Reviews.Content: My family an I are waiting for service in the apple store now. We made an appointment and got here early. They signed us in and then said that they are running behind by at least 15 minutes. Event though we are here before the appointment, they said we have to wait in the store until someone can work with us. So what was the point of the appointment? There are three of us forced to wait in the store or no service. This reminds me of waiting in the department of motor vehicles office. Oh wait, they are better now!Apple is great on the front end sales end and not good at all not he support/service end.

Reviews.Content: garageband unusable with real instruments unless other cable/adapters are bought. apple cuts features but keeps price high. been buying macs for 20 years but this is last mac i'll order. steer clear of these gaudy gadgets!
